item.title: Get Joel's Jacket From The Last of Us
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/get-joels-jacket-from-the-last-of-us/1100-6530658/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Last of Us returns to HBO on April 13, and it’s shaping up to be another emotional journey for Joel and Ellie. And if you’re looking for some inspiration for your spring wardrobe, consider taking a note from Joel. His iconic jacket isn’t some exclusive Hollywood costume. Instead, it’s a premium piece from Flint and Tinder that’s available for $298. It's a bit pricey for a jacket, but it’s earned rave reviews from buyers thanks to its durable construction and upscale design.

Flint and Tinder Flannel-Lined Waxed Trucker Jacket

$298

Sold by the popular lifestyle retailer, Huckberry, the Flint and Tinder Flannel-Lined Waxed Trucker Jacket is designed to grow better with age. According to the manufacturer, its weather-resistant Martexin sailcloth ages like leather or denim--meaning it’ll pick up a unique patina based on your wear patterns. It’s also designed to be soft and wearable right away, so you won’t have to worry about “breaking in” your new jacket.

Along with its waxed and weather-resistant Martexin 7 oz. sailcloth, the jacket is insulated for added warmth, features a body and sleeves lined with a striped blanket fabric, and comes with an interior pocket to hold your phone.

Four different colors are available, but stick with the standard Field Tan if you want the same one as Joel. You’ll also find seven different sizes and two different fits (classic or tall). Free shipping and returns are included for addresses within the US.

If you're curious how Season 2 is shaping up ahead of its premier on April 13, be sure to check out GameSpot's The Last of Us Season 2 review. Reviewer Mark Delany praises the first batch of episodes as a worthy follow-up to Season 1 and a great adaptation of the video game, saying, "Like its first season, The Last of Us Season 2 is a heart-wrenching examination of the ever-shifting distance between right and wrong, and as a whole, it's well on its way to becoming the best video game adaptation there is."

Though you’re cutting it close for a rewatch, The Last of Us: Season 1 4K Steelbook is currently on sale for $40.79 (was $50.55). Along with a 4K version of the film and a gorgeous steelbook, it includes over two hours of bonus content.

You’ll also find some nice discounts on action figures, board games, and even The Last of Us video games. One of the most unique discounts is for The Last of Us: Escape the Dark Board Game. The cooperative horror game has you and up to four other players attempting to reach Jackson while fending off infected and FEDRA agents. It’s close to its lowest-ever price and makes for an excellent way to kick off your watch party on Sunday.

We’ve rounded up our favorite The Last of Us deals below--consider checking them out if you want something to do in your fancy new jacket. Note that the limited edition DualSense Controller is sold out at most retailers, but our roundup makes it easy to quickly check a variety of storefronts to see if their inventory has been replenished.

The Last of Us Deals

  • The Last of Us Part 1 -- $49.49 ($70)
  • The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered -- $50
  • The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered (PC) -- $45 ($50)
  • Joel + Ellie Action Figures -- $39.79 ($50)
  • PlayStation DualSense Controller: The Last of Us Edition -- Sold Out
  • The Last of Us: Escape The Dark Board Game -- $69.33 ($75)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion Is First Switch 2 Game You Can Preorder In The US
  • Dune Lego Set Gets Rare Discount - Snag The Ornithopter For Its Best Price Yet
  • Astro Bot PS5 Console Bundle Deals Still Available At Amazon
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • Minecraft Movie Steelbook And Exclusive Crafting Table Edition Up For Preorder
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Preorders Delayed Due To Tariffs, Release Date Still June 5
  • MicroSD Express Cards For Nintendo Switch 2 - Here Are Your Options
  • Lego Mario Kart Building Sets Get Nice Discounts At Amazon
  • Pac-Man Fans Can Preorder Shadow Labyrinth Secret Edition For Only $60

item.title: The New Highest-Rated Game Of 2025 Is One You Might Not Know
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-new-highest-rated-game-of-2025-is-one-you-might-not-know/1100-6530673/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Blue Prince from Dogubomb and Raw Fury has emerged as the highest-rated game of 2025 thus far on GameSpot sister site Metacritic.

In Blue Prince, players explore a manor with shifting rooms. In practice, players must navigate this manor, solving the puzzles within each room before deciding which one to go into next. It has a roguelike structure, so the rooms within the manor reset each day and can slowly be upgraded over time depending on the player's actions. You might not have heard of Blue Prince before because it's an indie first-person puzzle game. That said, critics love its experimental structure and are heaping it with praise.

"Blue Prince is one of the most memorable video game experiences I have ever had," GameSpot's Steve Watts wrote in a glowing review. "It is at once accessible and impenetrable, frustrating and euphoric. Like each of my dozens of permutations of the Mount Holly manor house itself, it is truly one of a kind."

Blue Prince currently sits at a 92 on Metacritic, making its aggregate score the highest of 2025. It dethroned Split Fiction, which currently has an aggregate score of 91. Monster Hunter Wilds, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, and The Roottrees are Dead round out Metacritic's top five best-reviewed games of the year so far. That's some impressive company Blue Prince finds itself in, and suggests it will be this year's indie darling, just like Balatro was last year.

Blue Prince isn't out yet, and if you're a Game Pass subscriber, you won't even have to pay for it when it launches. It will be released on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S on April 10, and it will be available as part of the Xbox Game Pass Ultimate catalog.

Tomas Franzese on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Switch 2 Won't Bring Back eShop Music
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/switch-2-wont-bring-back-eshop-music/1100-6530670/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Nintendo has said that Switch 2's eShop won't have any theme music, just like the first Switch didn't, as a result of not wanting to disrupt the user experience.

In an interview with Polygon, Switch 2 producer Kouichi Kawamoto said, "Unlike back then, the eShop now has lots of videos that are showcasing the games." Before the Switch, systems like Wii and Wii U had music themes playing as users browsed their respective eShops. "We didn’t want to intrude on that, so we don’t have music there."

Kawamoto added that he wanted to make sure that browsing the Switch 2 eShop was a smooth experience, that the list doesn't stall, and that pages load fast. Due to those factors, the eShop won't have any theme music.

He also admitted that he booted up the Wii Shopping Channel the most out of any other application on the Wii system. The Wii Shopping channel is known for its catchy theme, and it's so popular that players created covers of it in Nintendo Labo.

Unfortunately, some Nintendo Labo kits are one of the few games that aren't backwards compatible on Switch 2. More specifically, it's the Labo Toy-Con 04: VR Kit. This kit requires players to insert the Switch tablet into the Toy-Con device. Since the Switch 2 tablet is larger than the original Switch, it won't fit.

Since the Switch 2 Direct last week, tons of new info dropped. Nintendo has defended Mario Kart World's staggering $80 price tag and the Switch 2 carts still taste bad, just like the carts of the first Switch. Nintendo Switch 2 launches on June 5.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
